More Service Cloud Features
Answer Questions with Generative Knowledge Answers

Integrate generative AI into your bot with the Generative Knowledge Answers. When a customer asks your bot a question, it uses the Answer Questions with Knowledge copilot action to search for relevant information in your knowledge base and then generate conversational answers.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions with an Einstein for Sales, Einstein for Platform, or Einstein for Service add-on and Einstein 1 Service Edition

USER PERMISSIONS
NEEDED
To build and manage Einstein Bots:
Customize Application
OR
Modify Metadata
OR
Manage Bots
To use Generative Knowledge Answers in Einstein bots, enable Lightning Knowledge. For the best results, add at least 10 knowledge articles to your knowledge base.

Before editing your bot’s settings, deactivate the bot.
When a customer asks your bot a question that doesn’t match to a dialog, it kicks off the Answer Questions with Knowledge copilot action. The copilot action executes a standard invocable action that searches for relevant knowledge articles. If the copilot action finds information, it sends a prompt to the LLM to generate a friendly message and then delivers the AI-generated response to the bot.

Currently, this feature is available in English only.
To enable Knowledge for the bot, go to the Settings section and click on the Knowledge tile. Then select Use features that intelligently search for knowledge articles with this bot.
For the Knowledge feature, select Copilot Action: Answer Questions with Knowledge.

By default, Generative Knowledge Answers grounds its response on all knowledge records and fields. To limit the information that the response is grounded on, select Custom Knowledge records and fields. Then select a data library.

To create a data library, click Go to Einstein Data Library Setup. Then, on the Einstein Data Library Setup page, create a library and assign it to Einstein Bots. To further customize your library, click your new library’s name. On the Fields Settings tab, you can add additional fields that you want Einstein to ground on. On the Knowledge Settings tab, you can filter the types of knowledge articles that Einstein grounds on.

When you're ready, save your changes and then select the data library on your bot’s Overview page.
Optionally, to deliver knowledge article citations with AI-generated bot messages, select Show sources and then enter your knowledge domain URL.

Save your changes.
On your bot’s Dialog page, you now see the Answer Questions with Knowledge dialog.
title: Answering Customer Questions with Service Cloud Generative AI
